sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Equinox (EQX) Touches All-Time High as Gold, Silver Soar
feed.summary: Equinox Gold Corp (EQX) reached an all-time high after gold and silver prices surged, driven by geopolitical tensions and strong preliminary production results for 2025. The company produced a record 922,827 ounces of gold in 2025, exceeding guidance, but projects a lower output for 2026. Despite its potential, the article suggests that some AI stocks may offer higher returns and lower risk.

feed.title: American Tower Corporation Announces Tax Reporting Information for 2025 Distributions
feed.summary: American Tower Corporation (NYSE: AMT) has released its year-end tax reporting information for distributions made in 2025, advising stockholders to consult their tax advisors. The announcement includes a detailed table outlining cash distributions, ordinary taxable dividends, qualified taxable dividends, Section 199A dividends, and Section 897 ordinary distributions per share across different record and payment dates throughout 2025. It also notes that the quarterly distribution declared in December 2025, payable in February 2026, will apply to the 2026 tax year.

feed.title: KEPCO calls for pan-government committee to secure Vietnam nuclear project
feed.summary: Korea Electric Power Corp. (KEPCO) has requested the government reactivate a pan-government export strategy committee to support its bid for the Ninh Thuan 2 nuclear power plant project in Vietnam, estimated at $22 billion. The committee, which includes various ministries, aims to provide comprehensive support including financing for large-scale projects. KEPCO is actively pursuing the project and believes a government-wide approach will enhance its chances against international competitors, particularly as Japan has withdrawn its bid.

feed.title: Fort Wayne business group study describes financial impact of proposed casino
feed.summary: A study commissioned by Greater Fort Wayne Inc. highlights the significant financial benefits of a local casino, projecting over $107 million in annual tax revenue, with $25 million directed to Fort Wayne. This new analysis surpasses a previous study from Full House Resorts, which estimated $80 million in annual taxes. The findings suggest a substantial economic boost for the city and surrounding areas.

feed.title: Why Hawaiian Electric Stock Slumped Today
feed.summary: Hawaiian Electric's stock (NYSE: HE) fell 2.5% today after Jefferies analyst Julian Dumoulin-Smith downgraded its rating from "buy" to "underperform" (sell) and lowered the price target to $12.50. The downgrade is attributed to increasing uncertainty regarding the utility's business, particularly legislative decisions on funding and customer rates. The analyst notes that while the stock has reached parity with other electric utilities, it faces more significant question marks, which could impact its future performance.

feed.title: Synchrony Financial Faces Rate Cap Risk Yet Screens As Undervalued
feed.summary: A new government proposal to cap credit card interest rates for one year could significantly impact Synchrony Financial (NYSE:SYF), a company heavily reliant on interest income from private label and co-branded credit cards. This regulatory risk, combined with ongoing discussions about the Credit Card Competition Act, adds uncertainty, despite Simply Wall St flagging the stock as undervalued. Investors are advised to monitor Synchrony's adjustments to product mix, credit standards, and customer offers should these regulatory changes materialize.

feed.title: Synchrony Financial Faces Rate Cap Risk Yet Screens As Undervalued
feed.summary: Synchrony Financial faces potential impact from a new government proposal to cap credit card interest rates, directly affecting its business model focused on private label and co-branded credit cards. Despite this regulatory risk, Simply Wall St assesses the company as undervalued, trading about 49.4% below its estimated fair value, although recent momentum has shown a 10.2% decline in the last 30 days. Investors are advised to monitor credit losses, potential shifts in credit standards, and the forecast decline in earnings by an average of 4.6% per year over the next three years if regulatory pressures increase.

feed.title: Weyerhaeuser Announces Tax Treatment of 2025 Dividend Distributions
feed.summary: Weyerhaeuser Company (NYSE: WY) has announced the income tax treatment for its 2025 dividend distributions, totaling $0.84 per share. All 2025 dividends are designated as capital gain distributions, making them ineligible for the 20 percent qualified business income deduction. The company advises shareholders to consult a tax advisor for their specific situations, noting that these allocations are based on the best available information prior to the filing of their 2025 tax return.

feed.title: Lam Research stock swings on tariff jitters as UBS lifts target ahead of earnings
feed.summary: Lam Research stock saw choppy trading after renewed tariff warnings rattled the market, despite UBS raising its price target on the company's shares. Investors are scrutinizing the upcoming January 28th earnings report for insights into its outlook and the wider chip industry's health, as political tensions and potential trade disputes threaten supply chains and customer spending.

feed.title: Assessing UnitedHealth Group (UNH) Valuation As Regulatory Scrutiny And Policy Shifts Intensify
feed.summary: UnitedHealth Group (UNH) is facing increased scrutiny due to alleged aggressive Medicare Advantage practices and President Trump's healthcare reform proposals targeting insurance middlemen. Despite a recent share price recovery, UNH has experienced significant long-term declines over the past one and three years. The article discusses whether the current market valuation, which sees UNH as undervalued at $338.43 compared to a fair value of $392, adequately accounts for these regulatory challenges or if further policy shifts could impact its future growth.

feed.title: PDD Holdings Under Investigation, Stock Price Drops Raises Concerns
feed.summary: PDD Holdings is reportedly under investigation by China's State Administration for Market Regulation for alleged fraudulent deliveries and tax issues, leading to a drop in its stock price on January 20, 2026. This probe, partly sparked by a physical altercation involving PDD employees and regulators, has prompted legal firms to offer consultations to investors seeking to recover losses. Despite the current concerns, Wall Street analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating with an average 1-year price target of $146.39.

feed.title: Ventas Announces Tax Treatment Of 2025 Distributions
feed.summary: Ventas, Inc. has announced the tax treatment of its distributions for the year 2025. This brief article from Reuters, distributed via Refinitiv, provides essential financial information concerning Ventas (VTR) and its dividends. The full details are accessible upon logging in or creating a free account.

feed.title: Ventas Announces Tax Treatment of 2025 Distributions
feed.summary: Ventas, Inc. (NYSE: VTR) has announced the tax treatment for its 2025 distributions on common stock, totaling $1.89 per share in taxable dividend income. The company provided a detailed table summarizing the nature of these cash distributions, including ordinary dividends, qualified dividends, and non-dividend distributions for each payment date in 2025. Additionally, the announcement includes specific reporting details for Section 199A Dividends and advises shareholders to consult their tax advisors.

feed.title: MAA Announces Taxable Composition of 2025 Distributions
feed.summary: Mid-America Apartment Communities, Inc. (MAA) has announced the taxable composition of its 2025 distributions to shareholders, indicating no portion is expected to be a return of capital and no foreign taxes were incurred. The release details the distribution classifications for both common stock and preferred stock, which are largely comprised of ordinary taxable distribution with a small percentage as long-term capital gain. This information is preliminary and provided to assist with 1099 form distribution.

feed.title: First Industrial Realty Trust Reports Tax Treatment of Common Stock Distributions
feed.summary: First Industrial Realty Trust, Inc. announced the tax treatment for its 2025 common stock distributions. The report provides a summary table detailing the cash distribution per share, ordinary dividends, qualified dividends, and Section 199A dividends for each quarter of 2025. Shareholders are advised to consult their tax advisors, as this report is based on preliminary results and may be subject to minor corrections.

feed.title: Fifth Circuit Court of Appeals Hands IRS Defeat in Limited Partner Definition Case
feed.summary: The Fifth Circuit Court of Appeals ruled in Sirius Solutions, LLLP v. Commissioner that a "limited partner" for self-employment tax purposes is defined by limited liability under state law, overturning the IRS's attempt to impose self-employment tax on their distributive shares. This decision may lead to refund claims for individuals who paid self-employment tax on limited partner interests and could influence future partnership filing positions, although its direct application to LLCs and LLPs remains uncertain. The IRS might petition for a rehearing or nonacquiesce, with similar cases pending in other circuit courts.

feed.title: Lobbying Update: $1,720,000 of PFIZER INC. lobbying was just disclosed
feed.summary: Pfizer Inc. has disclosed $1,720,000 in lobbying efforts for Q4 2025, focusing on critical issues like vaccine policy, drug pricing regulations, and international trade barriers. The article also details recent Congressional trading activity in PFE stock, hedge fund movements, and analyst ratings, with a median price target of $27.0.

feed.summary: NORTHROP GRUMMAN CORPORATION (NOC) recently disclosed $1,830,000 in lobbying expenditures for Q4 2025, covering issues such as defense authorization acts, appropriations, microelectronics, and export control reform. The article also details recent congressional and insider trading activity for NOC stock, hedge fund movements, analyst ratings, and price targets.

feed.summary: HUNTINGTON INGALLS INDUSTRIES INCORPORATED (HII) disclosed $1,580,000 in lobbying expenses for Q1 2025, covering issues such as environmental management, workforce development, and naval programs. The article also details recent insider trading activity, with more sales than purchases, and significant hedge fund movements in HII stock. Furthermore, recent analyst ratings show multiple "Buy" recommendations with a median price target of $346.0.

feed.title: Lobbying Update: $1,530,000 of ELEVANCE HEALTH INC. lobbying was just disclosed
feed.summary: Elevance Health Inc. recently disclosed $1,530,000 in lobbying expenditures for Q4 2025, covering diverse issues like ACA exchanges, mental health parity, AI in healthcare, and drug patent reform. The article also provides recent congressional stock trades involving ELV, insider trading activity, significant hedge fund movements, and current analyst ratings and price targets for the company's stock.

feed.title: Citigroup CEO Jane Fraser Doesn't Expect 'Sell America' Sentiment to Last in Markets
feed.summary: Citigroup CEO Jane Fraser believes that the current "Sell America" sentiment in financial markets, driven by geopolitical headlines, will not last. She argues that despite initial market volatility, there are no obvious alternative investment opportunities and that the American consumer and entrepreneur remain strong. Fraser and other analysts, like Wedbush, are optimistic that tensions will calm and investors will refocus on the strong fundamentals of the U.S. economy.

feed.title: Lobbying Update: $1,710,000 of CAPITAL ONE FINANCIAL CORPORATION lobbying was just disclosed
feed.summary: Capital One Financial Corporation (COF) recently disclosed $1,710,000 in lobbying expenditures for Q4 2025, covering issues such as tax code, consumer loans, fraud prevention, and community development financial institutions. The article also details recent congressional stock trading, insider trading, hedge fund activity, and analyst ratings and price targets for COF.

feed.title: Lobbying Update: $2,630,000 of CONOCOPHILLIPS lobbying was just disclosed
feed.summary: ConocoPhillips disclosed $2,630,000 in lobbying expenditures for Q4 2025, focusing on environmental policy, permitting reform, and oil and gas development. Key issues included streamlining environmental review processes, supporting specific legislation, and opposing certain BLM rules, particularly concerning the National Petroleum Reserve-Alaska (NPR-A) and the Willow project. The disclosure also covers congressional trading, insider trading, hedge fund activity, and analyst ratings related to ConocoPhillips (COP) stock.

feed.title: Lobbying Update: $2,890,000 of BOEING COMPANY lobbying was just disclosed
feed.summary: Boeing Company disclosed $2,890,000 in lobbying expenditures for Q4 2025, covering a broad range of issues including appropriations, aviation safety, defense, international sales, healthcare, homeland security, tax, and environmental regulations. The article also details recent congressional and insider trading activity in BA stock, as well as significant hedge fund movements and analyst ratings with price targets for the company.

feed.title: Lobbying Update: $3,150,000 of GENERAL MOTORS COMPANY lobbying was just disclosed
feed.summary: General Motors Company (GM) recently disclosed $3,150,000 in lobbying expenditures for Q4 2025, covering a range of issues from global market access to vehicle fuel economy and defense appropriations. The report also details recent insider trading activity, with GM insiders primarily selling shares, and institutional investor movements, showing both additions and reductions in GM stock holdings. Additionally, Wall Street analysts have issued various ratings and price targets for GM, with a median target of $86.0.

feed.title: Lobbying Update: $3,753,899 of GENERAL DYNAMICS CORP lobbying was just disclosed
feed.summary: General Dynamics Corp (GD) has disclosed $3,753,899 in lobbying expenditures for Q4 2025, covering a broad range of defense, appropriations, and regulatory issues. The article also details recent congressional and insider trading activity of GD stock, with both groups primarily selling shares. Furthermore, it highlights institutional investor movements and recent Wall Street analyst ratings and price targets for GD.

feed.title: Lobbying Update: $1,110,000 of DAVITA INC lobbying was just disclosed
feed.summary: DAVITA INC (DVA) recently disclosed $1,110,000 in lobbying expenditures for Q2 2025, focusing on critical issues for dialysis patients, nursing shortages, and Medicare regulations. This report also details recent DVA stock trading by members of Congress and company insiders, showing a greater number of sales than purchases. Furthermore, institutional holdings data indicates varied activity among hedge funds, while analysts have largely issued "Underperform" ratings, with a median price target of $140.0.

feed.summary: Advanced Micro Devices Inc. disclosed $1,670,000 in lobbying efforts for Q4 2025, focusing on issues like outbound investments, CHIPS implementation, AI policy, and export control changes. The article also details recent congressional stock trades, insider selling activity, hedge fund movements, and analyst ratings/price targets for AMD.

feed.title: Lobbying Update: $1,540,000 of COCA-COLA COMPANY lobbying was just disclosed
feed.summary: Coca-Cola Company disclosed $1,540,000 in lobbying expenses for Q4 2025, covering issues such as the USMCA, water resources, SNAP, and various tax codes. The article also details recent congressional stock trades for KO, insider trading activity, institutional investor movements, analyst ratings, and price targets.

feed.title: Lobbying Update: $2,159,000 of NEXTERA ENERGY INC lobbying was just disclosed
feed.summary: NEXTERA ENERGY INC (NEE) disclosed $2,159,000 in lobbying expenditures for Q4 2025, covering issues such as clean energy, nuclear energy, and tax incentives. The article also provides recent data on congressional stock trading in NEE, insider transactions, hedge fund activity, and analyst ratings with price targets for the stock.

feed.title: American Express Slipped 2% Last Week. Here’s What Investors Need to Know
feed.summary: American Express stock (AXP) fell by about 2% last week, primarily due to President Donald Trump's proposal for a 10% cap on credit card interest rates, which impacted the broader payments sector. Despite the selloff driven by regulatory concerns rather than company-specific news, a valuation model suggests a target price of $384, implying a 5.2% upside over the next two years. Future performance is tied to premium customer spending, expense management, and stable credit performance.

feed.title: Weyerhaeuser dividends tagged as capital gains for 2025, not 199A-eligible
feed.summary: Weyerhaeuser (NYSE: WY) announced that its 2025 dividend distributions, totaling $0.84 per share across four quarterly installments, are designated entirely as capital gain distributions for tax purposes. This means they are not eligible for the 20% qualified business income deduction under section 199A of the Internal Revenue Code, and no portion is classified as qualified dividends or nondividend distributions. The company noted that these allocations are based on the best available information and could change once its 2025 tax return is officially filed.

feed.title: American Tower Corporation Announces Tax Reporting Information for 2025 Distributions
feed.summary: American Tower Corporation (NYSE: AMT) has released its year-end tax reporting information for 2025 distributions, urging stockholders to consult their tax advisors. The bulletin details cash distribution, ordinary taxable dividends, qualified taxable dividends, Section 199A dividends, and Section 897 ordinary distributions per share across multiple record and payment dates in 2025. This final allocation explicitly states there were no capital gain, unrecaptured Section 1250 gain, or non-dividend distributions for the 2025 tax year.

feed.title: Park Hotels & Resorts Inc. Announces Tax Treatment of 2025 Dividends
feed.summary: Park Hotels & Resorts Inc. (NYSE:PK) has announced the tax reporting information for its 2025 cash distributions on its Common Stock, totaling $1.00 per share. These dividends are classified for income tax purposes as 75.9540% total ordinary dividends and 24.0460% total capital gain distribution. The company also provided a detailed table summarizing the income tax treatment of dividends paid quarterly throughout 2025 and into January 2026.

feed.title: Plymouth Industrial REIT Announces Tax Treatment of 2025 Dividends
feed.summary: Plymouth Industrial REIT (NYSE: PLYM) has announced the tax treatment for its 2025 dividends to common stockholders. The company provided a detailed table outlining the total cash distribution per share, including the ordinary dividend, capital gain distribution, unrecaptured Section 1250 gain, and return of capital for each quarter of 2025. This information is crucial for shareholders for their tax reporting purposes.

feed.title: SITE Centers Announces Tax Allocations of 2025 Dividend Distributions
feed.summary: SITE Centers Corp. (NYSE: SITC) has announced the tax allocations for its 2025 common share dividend distributions. The company provided a detailed schedule, on a per-share basis, clarifying the ordinary dividends, capital gain distribution, and return of capital for each of the four distributions in 2025 for informational tax purposes. Shareholders will find this information summarized on their Form 1099-DIV for their 2025 federal income tax returns.

feed.title: BRIXMOR PROPERTY GROUP ANNOUNCES TAX REPORTING INFORMATION FOR 2025 DISTRIBUTIONS
feed.summary: Brixmor Property Group Inc. has announced the tax reporting information for its 2025 common stock distributions, detailing the per-share breakdown for ordinary dividends, capital gain distributions, return of capital, and Section 199A dividends across four quarterly payments. The company provided a detailed table for tax purposes, outlining the various components of its distributions throughout 2025. Brixmor is a real estate investment trust (REIT) owning and operating open-air shopping centers, and it communicates material information through SEC filings, press releases, its website, and social media.

feed.title: Wells Fargo Downgrades Edison International (EIX) to Underweight with $59 Price Target
feed.summary: Wells Fargo has downgraded Edison International (EIX) from Equal Weight to Underweight, setting a $59 price target, primarily due to ongoing uncertainties surrounding the Eaton Fire liability and California's regulatory environment. The unresolved fire claims and legal complexities are seen as significant operational risks, despite some potential positives from a recent lawsuit. Analyst consensus projects a higher average price target for EIX, but Wells Fargo emphasizes focusing on fundamental reasons for rating changes.

feed.title: Kite Realty Group Announces Tax Reporting Information for 2025 Dividend Distributions
feed.summary: Kite Realty Group (NYSE: KRG) has announced the tax reporting allocations for its 2025 dividend distributions on common stock. The announcement details how the dividends will be reported on Form 1099-DIV, breaking down the per-share distributions into ordinary dividends, capital gain distribution, non-taxable distribution, and Section 199A dividends for each quarter of 2025. The company, a real estate investment trust specializing in open-air shopping centers and mixed-use assets, provided this information for stockholders' tax preparation.

feed.title: Lobbying Update: $1,160,000 of STATE STREET BANK AND TRUST COMPANY AND ITS AFFILIATES lobbying was just disclosed
feed.summary: STATE STREET BANK AND TRUST COMPANY AND ITS AFFILIATES disclosed $1,160,000 in lobbying expenditures for Q4 2025, covering issues such as tax changes, retirement savings, financial services regulation, and digital assets. The article also provides details on recent congressional stock trading, insider trading activity, hedge fund movements, and analyst ratings for STT stock. The lobbying efforts touched on various regulatory and legislative topics relevant to the financial industry.

feed.title: AvalonBay Communities Announces 2025 Dividend Income Tax Treatment
feed.summary: AvalonBay Communities, Inc. announced the final income allocations for its 2025 dividend distributions on its Common Stock. The announcement details the tax treatment for four quarterly dividends, classifying portions as ordinary taxable dividends, long-term capital gains, and unrecaptured Section 1250 gain, and advises shareholders to consult their tax advisors. The company, an S&P 500 equity REIT, develops and manages apartment communities across major metropolitan areas in the U.S.

feed.title: Coca-Cola and Procter & Gamble outperform on a bruising day overall for U.S. stocks (KO:NYSE)
feed.summary: Coca-Cola (KO) and Procter & Gamble (PG) showed strong performance on a challenging Tuesday for U.S. stocks. The broader market experienced a decline following President Donald Trump's threat of new tariffs on European nations. These consumer staples companies managed to outperform amidst the overall negative market sentiment.

feed.title: U.S. Bancorp CEO warns of big hit from Trump’s credit card cap
feed.summary: U.S. Bancorp CEO Gunjan Kedia has warned that former President Donald Trump's proposed 10% cap on credit card interest rates would severely impact over 90% of the bank's clients and the broader economy, with a "crushing" effect on 50% of customers. The banking industry is awaiting clarity on the January 20 deadline for this cap, which analysts believe would require legislation and is unlikely to pass. Kedia also mentioned that the bank's fourth-quarter profit exceeded expectations due to increased interest payments and fee revenue growth.

feed.title: $0.76 from Douglas Emmett in 2025 counts as return of capital
feed.summary: Douglas Emmett, Inc. (NYSE: DEI) (a REIT), announced the tax treatment of its 2025 common stock dividends. The total dividend per share for 2025 is $0.76, all of which is classified as a return of capital for tax purposes. Shareholders are advised to consult their personal tax advisors for specific tax treatment.

feed.title: Microsoft wants to build 15 more data centers in Mount Pleasant
feed.summary: Microsoft is planning a significant expansion in Mount Pleasant, proposing to construct 15 additional data centers across two new campuses valued at over $13 billion. This expansion comes as the tech giant is already investing more than $7 billion in two existing data center projects in the village. The plans are currently under review, with the village's planning commission recommending approval contingent on meeting conditions regarding traffic impact and water usage.

feed.title: Palo Alto Networks stock slips as tariff jitters hit tech, with $200 calls in play
feed.summary: Palo Alto Networks (PANW) stock dropped 1.7% to $184.41 following President Donald Trump's threat of new tariffs on European nations, triggering a broader tech sell-off and risk aversion. Options trading saw significant activity in $200 strike calls expiring on January 30, with over 30,000 contracts traded. Despite the dip, Citizens analyst Trevor Walsh maintained a Market Outperform rating and a $250 price target for PANW, with the next earnings report expected on February 12.

feed.title: US bank stocks fall as investors await credit card rate cap deadline
feed.summary: US bank stocks experienced a decline as investors awaited a crucial deadline set by the Trump administration for a proposed 10% cap on credit card interest rates. Banks have expressed concerns that such a cap would reduce credit availability and impact profitability, while the administration argues it would improve affordability for consumers. Major banks like JPMorgan Chase, Citigroup, Wells Fargo, Morgan Stanley, and Goldman Sachs saw their shares fall, with industry experts suggesting a political compromise may be sought to avert unilateral implementation.

feed.title: Oklo Inc (OKLO) stock price slides as tariff shock hits Wall Street — what to watch next
feed.summary: Oklo Inc. (OKLO) stock fell by 5.0% to $90.18 amidst a wider market selloff triggered by new tariff threats from President Donald Trump. This slide also impacted other nuclear and power-related stocks. Investors are currently watching for funding signals and the upcoming quarterly update, following Oklo's recent announcements regarding a significant deal with Meta and a contract with the U.S. Department of Energy.

feed.title: UNH vs. MOH: Which Insurer Can Better Navigate Current Volatility?
feed.summary: This article compares UnitedHealth Group (UNH) and Molina Healthcare (MOH), two major U.S. health insurers, amid policy uncertainty and market volatility. It highlights UnitedHealth's advantages in scale, diversification through its Optum platform, profitability, and financial flexibility, making it more resilient to regulatory shifts. Molina, while strong in Medicaid-focused managed care, is more vulnerable due to its narrower business model and higher exposure to state-level reimbursement decisions.

feed.title: T-Mobile stock price slides to a fresh 52-week low as tariff jitters hit Wall Street
feed.summary: T-Mobile (TMUS) stock dropped to a new 52-week low of $184.04 amid renewed concerns over global tariffs and an upcoming fee adjustment. This decline, contrasting with gains by Verizon, reflects investor jitters over broader market uncertainties and potential subscriber churn due to increased service charges. The company is set to release its Q4 and full-year 2025 results on February 11, which will also include updated financial targets for 2026 and 2027.
